speaker: Teacher
text: Time for group presentations! Sarah's team is up first.

speaker: Sarah Chen
text: Good morning everyone. Our team researched renewable energy, specifically solar power. Before I start, I want to acknowledge my teammates Emma and Marcus - they did amazing work on this project.

speaker: Sarah Chen
text: That's okay, I'll wait... So, as I was saying, solar panels convert sunlight into electricity through photovoltaic cells.

speaker: Teacher
text: Sarah, can you speak up please? Some students in the back can't hear.

speaker: Sarah Chen
text: Oh, sorry! Is this better? I'll project my voice more. Let me repeat that last part for anyone who missed it. Solar panels convert sunlight into electricity through photovoltaic cells.

speaker: Student
text: I don't get it. How does that even work?

speaker: Sarah Chen
text: That's a great question! Let me explain it another way. Think of it like a plant doing photosynthesis, but instead of making food, the panel makes electricity. The sunlight hits special materials that get excited and create an electric current.

speaker: Student
text: Oh! That makes more sense now.

speaker: Sarah Chen
text: Awesome! Does anyone else have questions before I continue? I want to make sure everyone understands each part.

speaker: Emma Johnson
text: Sarah, should we show them the model Marcus built now?

speaker: Sarah Chen
text: Perfect timing Emma! Yes, this will help visualize what I just explained. Marcus, do you want to explain your building process?

speaker: Marcus Williams
text: Sure! So when I was building this...

speaker: Teacher
text: Excellent presentation Sarah. You handled those interruptions very professionally and made sure everyone could understand.

speaker: Sarah Chen
text: Thank you! I practiced a lot last night, but I was still really nervous. Taking a breath when my phone buzzed helped me stay focused.
